ogTitle: the world's only remaining blockbuster store, located in bend, or, announces it's becoming an airbnb for locals. - smarther news
ogDescription: when you call dibs on this stay, you’re booking a night back in the 90s, but this time you won’t have to beg your parents to rent the latest horror flick–we’ll give you the keys to the entire store!
quote: When you call dibs on this stay, you’re booking a night back in the 90s, but this time you won’t have to beg your parents to rent the latest horror flick–we’ll give you the keys to the entire store!
summary: The world’s only remaining Blockbuster store, located in Bend, OR, announces it’s becoming an Airbnb for locals.
body:
• The once ever-popular video rental store chain first opened its doors in 1985, and by 2004 there were more than 9,000 Blockbuster stores in America alone.
  • But by 2010, as the popularity of Netflix and other streaming services grew, Blockbuster filed for bankruptcy. and most of its remaining 3,000 stores began to shut their doors. In 2013, only 300 or so were left standing. The second-to-last Blockbuster (located in Australia) closed in  2019.
  • Here’s The Deal: The limited-time Airbnb is open to Deschutes County residents only. On August 17th, beginning at 1pm the Airbnb listing will become active – allowing locals in parties up to four to book a one-night stay on September 18th, 19th, or 20th – for 4 bucks!
    • Why only $4? The owner of the store is thanking the local community for its years of support, especially most recently during the COVID-19 pandemic.
